channel.title: Vote4Cash not giving money
channel.description:
Everything is added right, the mysql is done right.. no errors.
I vote than go in-game "::check" and always get the "you haven't voted yet" message.. Even though i go back to vote on my "vote.php" page and get the "you have already voted" from the page... And the comment is also good..
So yeah, what could be the problem..

item.title: Vote4Cash not giving money
item.dc:creator: @dzeko dzeko
item.description:
@dzeko wrote:

Lil wayne fan:

no, i have manger, and mines still work, i’m almost 99% sure, its your reward command, but i could be wrong, you should post command, and ill see

if (playerCommand.startsWith("check")) { if(c.checkVotes(c.playerName)) { c.getItems().addItem(995, 10000000); c.sendMessage("You have received 10m for voting!"); } else { c.sendMessage("You haven't voted yet, please type ::vote!"); } }

Read full topic

item.title: Vote4Cash not giving money
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“dzeko, post:4, topic:440723”]my webhosting is a paid hosting.
I don’t think it’s a mysql error…
i don’t receive message from my database saying “cannot connect to databse…”
it connect’s, i vote. Then go to my phpadmin, i see “received” changed from 0 to 1…

So for sure it’s something in my client…
Do I have to create a MYSQL.java? i saw it in tut, but can’t remember it anymore… :S[/quote]

Oh my god… That would be why you aren’t getting a “cannot connect to database” error. The tutorials have you either make a SQL.java or MySQL.java.

Read full topic

item.title: Vote4Cash not giving money

i have mysqlmanager.java
[/quote]

I think something needs to be declared in client.java and also something needs to be connecting to your sql every time your server starts.[/quote]

i’ve already declared:

import java.net.URL; import java.net.MalformedURLException; import java.io.InputStreamReader; import java.io.BufferedReader; import java.io.IOException;
…

item.title: Vote4Cash not giving money
item.dc:creator: @Lord_Torax Lord Torax
item.description:
@Lord_Torax wrote:

Yeah you gotta have something in your server files so when that player types in their name on your vote page and types ::check it will tell the vote page that the player has received the reward.

Read full topic

it connect’s, i vote. Then go to my phpadmin, i see “received” changed from 0 to 1…

item.title: Vote4Cash not giving money
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Lord is right. We need to know what host you are using and if you are using premium etc. And make sure the ::check command is actually linking to the MySQL. I remember having an issue with making a command do it so when they did the ::vote command I made the server kick them and on the website it would say “Please don’t log back in until you have finished voting” because on log in it would do a vote check. Much more efficient.

Read full topic

item.title: Vote4Cash not giving money
item.dc:creator: @Lord_Torax Lord Torax
item.description:
@Lord_Torax wrote:

[quote=“dzeko, post:1, topic:440723”]Everything is added right,
the mysql is done right… no errors.

I vote than go in-game “::check” and always get the “you haven’t voted yet” message…
Even though i go back to vote on my “vote.php” page and get the “you have already voted” from the page…
And the comment is also good…

So yeah, what could be the problem…[/quote]

Everything is not added right like you say, cause if it was would you be having this problem? no.

Check the database connection and make sure you are using the right information, also let me know what host you are using.

Read full topic
